page.title: 01KIPPEN
page.content: Kippen Village is about 17 kilometers west of Stirling,mid way between Edinburgh and Glasgow.It lies at the edge of Flanders Moss on the slopes of the Gargunnock hills with magnificent views north over the carse towards the mountains.The name Kippen comes from either a Gaelic word meaning "Little Stump" or from "Cape End"when the sea covered the carse.There are about 1000 inhabitants.Shops include a Post office and grocer,part-time bank,2 grocers,a paper shop,a hairdresser,an antique shop,a baker,a butcher and a family fashions shop.The village also has 2 hotels with bars and 2 garages,a Reading room,Village hall and a Primary school.Fish,fruit and butcher vans also visit regularly. The Mobile Library comes to Kippen every Tuesday.
